author: vors
body:
## Steps to reproduce

```
Split-Path -Path "\\server1\Share"
```
## Expected behavior

On Windows, it returns `$null` by design as discussed in #2202
## Actual behavior

On macOS and Linux it returns `//server1`.

**Note:** we already have platform-specifc behavior for `Split-Path`, because it normalizes slashes differently, so it could be ok.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Seems like there would be value to get just the server name although it's not a valid filesystem/UNC path

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee discussed this and believe that split-path should return `server` in the case of \\\\server\share on all systems for -parent (default) and `share` for -leaf

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT just to double check

```
> split-path -parent '\\server\path'
\\server
```

not `server`, right?

comments.author: vors
comments.body: We will work on making it preserve the `\\` as is on all platforms
